title: National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 1986) (as adapted by the Culture,
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the National Archives Act 1986 (Section
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the National Archives Act 1986 (Section 

8(1A)) (Transfer of Departmental Records) Order 2024.
text_norm: 1 order may cited national archive act 1986 (section 8(1a)) (transfer departmental records) order 2024

title: National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 1986) (as adapted by the Culture,
heading: 2. This Order shall come into operation on 1 December 2024.
text_raw: 2. This Order shall come into operation on 1 December 2024.

title: National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 1986) (as adapted by the Culture,
heading: 3. The following class of Departmental records which are less than 30 years
text_raw:
3. The following class of Departmental records which are less than 30 years 
old but more than 20 years old, namely Anglo Irish records relating to the peace 
process and Northern Ireland, including Departmental records relating to the 
Good Friday Agreement, for the period from 1 January 2004 to 30 November 
2004, that are held by the Department of the Taoiseach, shall be transferred, in 
accordance with the National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 1986), to the 
National Archives. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 20th December, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [702] 3 

The Taoiseach consents to the making of the foregoing Order. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Taoiseach, 

20 November, 2024. 

SIMON HARRIS, 

Taoiseach. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform consents to the making of the foregoing Order. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister 

for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan 
Delivery and Reform 

21 November, 2024. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

29 November, 2024. 

CATHERINE MARTIN, 

Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and 
Media.
